content:
• Friday, April 13, 2012
  • FFIV

    Whose channel checks on F5 Networks (FFIV -1.6%) are more accurate, William Blair's or Piper's?...

    Whose channel checks on F5 Networks (FFIV -1.6%) are more accurate, William Blair's or Piper's? The former said on Wednesday its checks painted a downbeat picture, but the latter said today F5 resellers largely finished the March quarter above plan, and that it expects new products, data center trends, and growing security-related sales to drive shares higher. We'll know who's right when F5 reports on Wednesday. (Nomura) (Merrill) (Sterne Agee)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW +3.1%) outperformed after Piper launched coverage with an Overweight. Piper notes...

    VMware (VMW +3.1%) outperformed after Piper launched coverage with an Overweight. Piper notes VMware has an 82% revenue share of the white-hot virtualization market (per IDC), in spite of ample competition, and expects VMware's huge installed base to give it plenty of chances to cross-sell complementary software. Interestingly, 80% owner EMC (EMC -1.1%) sold off with the market in spite of VMware's rise.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • PCO

    Patent & litigation services firm Pendrell (PCO -17.6%) crashed in late trading before being...

    Patent & litigation services firm Pendrell (PCO -17.6%) crashed in late trading before being halted at 3:30 PM ET. News is reportedly pending. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • SODA

    Sodastream (SODA +3%) closes with a healthy gain thanks to a bullish William Blair note. The...

    Sodastream (SODA +3%) closes with a healthy gain thanks to a bullish William Blair note. The firm is high on the long-term potential of the home soda machine market, and thinks growing U.S. sales could allow Sodastream's annual EPS to reach $5 in the next several years (2012 consensus is $1.61). WB also reiterates its prediction that Wal-Mart will sell Sodastream machines, and expects drugstores and grocery stores to follow suit in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 7 Comments
  • TOT

    Total (TOT -2.5%) says it's making significant progress in stopping the gas leak on well G4 on...

    Total (TOT -2.5%) says it's making significant progress in stopping the gas leak on well G4 on its Elgin platform. The company said two rigs are being mobilized for the drilling of relief wells and all operations to stop the leak are progressing according to plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW -5.5%) slips after J.P. Morgan says sales of the company's new Sapien...

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW -5.5%) slips after J.P. Morgan says sales of the company's new Sapien heart valve will be weaker than expected because it is hard to identify patients ideal for the product. The firm believes EW is likely to cut Q1 and 2012 sales guidance because Sapien sales in the U.S. have been disappointing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • CME

    Independent traders staged a walkout of CME Group (CME -1.7%) options on Eurodollar futures,...

    Independent traders staged a walkout of CME Group (CME -1.7%) options on Eurodollar futures, protesting a large, privately negotiated trade a day earlier they claimed was unfair. Floor traders suddenly got tired of being dinosaurs: "This has been going on for years," one trader says. "The pit traders aren't privy to the information... [we] are so behind the curve."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSD

    Simpson Manufacturing (SSD +2%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Longbow. The firm says that Q1...

    Simpson Manufacturing (SSD +2%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Longbow. The firm says that Q1 checks indicate the company is experiencing solid sales growth in the mid-to-high teens, expanded gross margin and moderating material costs, and expects the company to beat estimates in the current quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • EAT

    Brinker (EAT +2.1%) shares respond favorably to yesterday's California Supreme Court decision...

    Brinker (EAT +2.1%) shares respond favorably to yesterday's California Supreme Court decision that employers in the state must provide uninterrupted meal breaks for hourly workers after they are on the clock for more than five hours, but aren't required to make sure those employees do no work during that period.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLD

    Cloud Peak Energy (CLD -3%) trades off after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral, citing...

    Cloud Peak Energy (CLD -3%) trades off after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral, citing reduced 2013 thermal price expectations and overly optimistic consensus estimates by the Street.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • JPM

    JPMorgan Chase's (JPM -2.8%) better than expected Q1 had analysts asking whether it might use a...

    JPMorgan Chase's (JPM -2.8%) better than expected Q1 had analysts asking whether it might use a special dividend to return capital, but Jamie Dimon shot down the idea, saying the possibility was "off the table" since the bank doesn't yet know the final shape of new capital requirements. "No bank is so strong that it should throw caution to the wind," David Reilly writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE -2%) dips on cautious comments out of Deutsche today, saying the shares may have been...

    Cree (CREE -2%) dips on cautious comments out of Deutsche today, saying the shares may have been pricing in good news over the near-term, but the set-up going into the March quarter earnings may not be so positive. The firm expects results to be in-line with estimates and feels the stock may have overshot the drop zone from a valuation perspective.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • JPM

    Better than expected earnings may not be helping JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) shares, but as one of the...

    Better than expected earnings may not be helping JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) shares, but as one of the largest U.S. credit card issuers, Citi analysts think its positive trends bode well for issuers. JPM's Y/Y growth rate of card spending is moving up and Q2 charge-offs are expected to improve, apparently "a sold read through" for V +1.5%, MA +1.7% and AXP -0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • MO

    Altria Group (MO +1.1%) moves up on a Davenport upgrade to Buy earlier today. The firm is...

    Altria Group (MO +1.1%) moves up on a Davenport upgrade to Buy earlier today. The firm is recommending snapping up the shares on any weakness ahead of the Q1 report on April 26 as it expects stronger than expected volume results from its Marlboro brand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • QSFT

    Quest Software (QSFT +1.4%) rises to $23.40 on a down day, as speculators bet a tech company...

    Quest Software (QSFT +1.4%) rises to $23.40 on a down day, as speculators bet a tech company will trump Insight Venture Partners' $23/share bid. Last week, shareholders filed suit against Quest, accusing CEO Vinny Smith of quickly agreeing to a buyout in order to avoid an SEC investigation into Quest's accounting. Quest defends itself through a proxy filing that details the events leading to its LBO deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • ABC

    AmerisourceBergen (ABC -3%) dips after being downgraded to Equal Weight on valuation at Morgan...

    AmerisourceBergen (ABC -3%) dips after being downgraded to Equal Weight on valuation at Morgan Stanley earlier today, citing limited upside catalysts over the near-term.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • NOK

    Barclays' downgrade of Nokia (NOK -4.6%) is helping the stock make multi-decade lows today. Of...

    Barclays' downgrade of Nokia (NOK -4.6%) is helping the stock make multi-decade lows today. Of note is the firm's downbeat smartphone commentary: Nokia's 2M+ Q1 Lumia shipments missed Barclays' forecast of 3.5M, and the firm now expects the company's 2012 smartphone shipments to amount to just 52M (29M Windows Phone, 23M Symbian). That represents a 33% drop in a year when multiple firms expect smartphone shipments to rise 46%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 16 Comments
  • BKS

    Goldman Sachs cuts its price target on Barnes & Noble (BKS -3.1%) by a buck to $14 as it takes...

    Goldman Sachs cuts its price target on Barnes & Noble (BKS -3.1%) by a buck to $14 as it takes the consensus view that the e-book settlement poses another headwind to profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural (ANR -3.8%) slips despite being upgraded to Buy earlier today at Nomura, naming it...

    Alpha Natural (ANR -3.8%) slips despite being upgraded to Buy earlier today at Nomura, naming it a Top Pick in the coal space. The firm says that CAPP thermal concerns are less than feared, and that coal exports are looking strong and met coal prices have bottomed.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • JADE

    China-based jewelry distributor LJ International (JADE -16.2%) is postponing its quarterly...

    China-based jewelry distributor LJ International (JADE -16.2%) is postponing its quarterly report scheduled for Monday, saying a year-end audit of its financial statements needs more time to be completed.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • CZR

    Caesars (CZR -5.0%) trades lower after entering a common equity distribution agreement with...

    Caesars (CZR -5.0%) trades lower after entering a common equity distribution agreement with Citigroup and Credit Suisse to issue and sell up to 10M shares of its common stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE -6.9%) shares sag after the company’s strategy meeting yesterday, which followed...

    Sony (SNE -6.9%) shares sag after the company’s strategy meeting yesterday, which followed the warning earlier this week of a larger than expected loss in the latest fiscal year. The meeting “did not contain any surprises,” Credit Suisse says, believing "explanations regarding the timeframe for execution and assessment of proposed initiatives fell somewhat short."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • PRMW

    Shares of Primo Water (PRMW +15.4%) surge after the provider of bottled water and water...

    Shares of Primo Water (PRMW +15.4%) surge after the provider of bottled water and water dispensers says it expects to obtain a total of as much as $35M in financing from two lenders. PRMW shares, now at ~$1.85, have been in a constant slide since coming public 18 months ago above $10.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • NEI

    Network Engines (NEI -25.9%) shares slide after the provider of server-based application...

    Network Engines (NEI -25.9%) shares slide after the provider of server-based application platforms' says its largest customer, EMC, plans a transition away from products representing ~$21M in quarterly revenue in a switch expected to begin as early as the end of this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • SWY

    JPMorgan analyst Ken Goldman tells clients that Safeway (SWY +3.1%) could see some sort of...

    JPMorgan analyst Ken Goldman tells clients that Safeway (SWY +3.1%) could see some sort of corporate action, adding a bit more weight to swirling chatter that the grocery store chain is a target. Shares are now up over 8% for the week on above-average trading volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • GS

    In 2011, Goldman Sachs' (GS -3.5%) earnings fell 47%, its stock price tumbled 46% and the...

    In 2011, Goldman Sachs' (GS -3.5%) earnings fell 47%, its stock price tumbled 46% and the company cut loose 2,400 employees. By those measures, Lloyd Blankfein's 35% cut in total compensation to $12M seems generous. His pay compares to $10.5M for James Gorman (NYSE:MS), $15M for Vikram Pandit (NYSE:C) and $23M for Jamie Dimon (NYSE:JPM).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • TK

    A pair of Teekay (TK -1.6%) spinoffs raised their quarterly dividends late yesterday, joining a...

    A pair of Teekay (TK -1.6%) spinoffs raised their quarterly dividends late yesterday, joining a growing list of companies seeking to add shareholder value with bigger payouts. Teekay Offshore Partners (TOO +2%) increased its dividend by 2.5%, while Teekay LNG Partners (TGP +0.9%) ups its dividend by 7.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • AAPL

    Possibly contributing to today's weakness in Apple (AAPL -2.5%) is another cautious note from...

    Possibly contributing to today's weakness in Apple (AAPL -2.5%) is another cautious note from Wedge Partners' Brian Blair (previous), who argues FQ2 iPad expectations are too high. Blair believes just 11M iPads were sold in FQ2, well below a consensus of 13M. He also worries iPhone sales (the majority of Apple's gross profit) could disappoint if estimates rise further.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 44 Comments
  • GWR

    Genesee & Wyoming's (GWR -1.6%) March rail traffic fell 13.6% Y/Y, and Q1 traffic slid...

    Genesee &Wyoming's (GWR -1.6%) March rail traffic fell 13.6% Y/Y, and Q1 traffic slid 9.2% Y/Y, mostly due to huge dropoffs in coal shipments. Coal represents the largest volume of traffic on U.S. railroads, which have hauled nearly 200K fewer carloads of coal this year than last year. CSX -1.1%, UNP -1%, KSU -0.6%, NSC -0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 3 Comments
  • MAPP

    Map Pharmaceuticals (MAPP -2.7%) says it plans to meet with the FDA during the current quarter...

    Map Pharmaceuticals (MAPP -2.7%) says it plans to meet with the FDA during the current quarter to discuss manufacturing issues that are hindering the approval of its migraine medication Levadex.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • COSI

    Cosi (COSI -9.4%) says it plans to launch a rights offering for up to 19.9% of its common stock...

    Cosi (COSI -9.4%) says it plans to launch a rights offering for up to 19.9% of its common stock to shareholders. The company plans to use the proceeds for planned growth initiatives as well as general corporate purposes, including stepped-up efforts to increase traffic in its stores.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • AA

    A day after rallying strongly, many commodity names are selling off as a result of top customer...

    A day after rallying strongly, many commodity names are selling off as a result of top customer China's soft GDP report. Copper (CU -2.4%), silver (SLVP -1.8%), and gold (PSAU -1.6%) miners are all getting hit, as are steelmakers (SLX -1.9%) and some aluminum names (AA -2.2%, NOR -3.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • IGTE

    IGate (IGTE +9.1%) pops after its Q1 revenues soared by 247% Y/Y to $263M, up from $76M in Q1...

    IGate (IGTE +9.1%) pops after its Q1 revenues soared by 247% Y/Y to $263M, up from $76M in Q1 2011. Net income was also higher, rising a greater-than-anticipated 35% as the surge in revenue compensated for slightly weaker margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • GOOG

    Google (GOOG -2.4%) is now heading south following its Q1 report and "stock split," even though...

    Google (GOOG -2.4%) is now heading south following its Q1 report and "stock split," even though analyst targets are moving higher in response. Wells Fargo is joining Deutsche in predicting shares will tread water over the near-term, but that mobile ad rates will eventually improve. Benchmark, however, is concerned about the impact of Google's mobile revenue-sharing deals, and the inability of high-end Android tablets to compete against the iPad. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • MFB

    Shares of Maidenform Brands (MFB +4.1%) kick up a healthy gain after Stephens initiates coverage...

    Shares of Maidenform Brands (MFB +4.1%) kick up a healthy gain after Stephens initiates coverage with an Overweight rating. The apparel maker only has an average price target on the Street of $25.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • UHS

    Universal Health Services (UHS -2%) expects to receive ~$35M to correct underpayment from the...

    Universal Health Services (UHS -2%) expects to receive ~$35M to correct underpayment from the Medicare inpatient prospective payment system in an industry-wide settlement with the U.S. government. Tenet Healthcare had already said it should receive $84M as part of the settlement and raised its full-year guidance in response.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • ARCW

    ARC Wireless Solutions (ARCW +15.6%) says it will acquire two companies with metal injection...

    ARC Wireless Solutions (ARCW +15.6%) says it will acquire two companies with metal injection molding assets in deals valued at a combined $74M and change its name to ARCGroup Worldwide to reflect its transformation to a diversified manufacturing holding company.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • SAN

    Europe touches new session lows about an hour and a half before its close for the week. Stoxx 50...

    Europe touches new session lows about an hour and a half before its close for the week. Stoxx 50 -2.3%, Spain (earlier) -3.3%, Italy -2.8%, Germany -2.1%. Banco Santander (STD -3.3%), SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY -5.4%, Deutsche Bank (DB -3.8%), Financial ETF: EUFN -2.3%. Euro -0.7% to $1.3099.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 5 Comments
  • INFY

    Infosys (INFY -13.5%) is plunging after delivering a weak FQ4 report, and is taking other IT...

    Infosys (INFY -13.5%) is plunging after delivering a weak FQ4 report, and is taking other IT outsourcing names down with it: WIT -3.7%. CTSH -2.8%. SYNT -2%. ACN -1.5%. HPQ -2%. Also hurting is Infosys' guidance for FY13 revenue of $7.55B-$7.69B and EPS of $3.12-$3.17 (consensus is for $7.96B and $3.25). "The year ahead looks challenging for the IT services industry," says the company's CEO. Are cloud services part of the problem?

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • JOEZ

    Shares of Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ) soar 21.1% higher off of a FQ1 report that beat the...

    Shares of Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ) soar 21.1% higher off of a FQ1 report that beat the consensus estimate of analysts on the top-line result and for gross margin.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 3 Comments
  • CTS

    Electronics contract manufacturer CTS is down 12.9% premarket after warning it expects Q1 EPS of...

    Electronics contract manufacturer CTS is down 12.9% premarket after warning it expects Q1 EPS of $0.05-$0.07, below a Street estimate of $0.16. The company, which just restarted manufacturing at a Thai facility crippled by flooding, blames lagging insurance reimbursements, customer returns, and a slow start to Q1. CTS is reiterating its 2012 EPS guidance of $0.75-$0.80 ($0.78 consensus). Some of CTS' peers: JBL, FLEX, SANM, CLS, PLXS, NTE.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • CVI

    CVR Energy (NYSE:CVI) discloses that it met with Carl Icahn regarding his bid for the company...

    CVR Energy (NYSE:CVI) discloses that it met with Carl Icahn regarding his bid for the company and push to name directors. With 55% of CVR's shares tendered into Icahn's $30 bid, the company lost its bid to beat back the investor but still has a poison pill in place that limits any more Icahn share purchases. Shares +0.6% premarket, +23.5% post-Icahn interest.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • MU

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) -2.7% after S&P slashes its credit outlook to negative, and the company...

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) -2.7% after S&P slashes its credit outlook to negative, and the company prices its $870M convertible note offering, which could be ammo for an Elpida bid. While the interest rates for the notes are low, they sport conversion prices below $10/share, which makes future dilution a strong possibility. Nonetheless, Baird considers Micron's recent selloff a buying opportunity, and predicts the chipmaker will return to profitability this summer.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • PWAV

    Powerwave Technologies (NASDAQ:PWAV) -27% premarket after issuing downside Q1 guidance, seeing...

    Powerwave Technologies (NASDAQ:PWAV) -27% premarket after issuing downside Q1 guidance, seeing revenues of $40M-$45M vs. $62.3M consensus. PWAV says it continued to encounter weakness in several of its markets, as network operators were conservative in their spending plans and several markets continued to delay capital spending plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • SAP

    SAP +1.8% premarket after reaffirming Q2 and FY 2012 guidance while seeing Q1 revenue slightly...

    SAP +1.8% premarket after reaffirming Q2 and FY 2012 guidance while seeing Q1 revenue slightly below consensus. Q1 license sales rose 4% Y/Y to €637M, less than the €688M euro consensus, but the enterprise software maker expects a strong Q2 with software revenue growth of 15%-20%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) +4.7% premarket on reports it is set to hold a near-monopoly on...

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) +4.7% premarket on reports it is set to hold a near-monopoly on U.S. exports of liquid natural gas if a Louisiana plant gets approved. The U.S. government may decide as soon as next week on LNG’s request to build the $10B plant that would be the largest in the U.S. to liquefy gas and load it onto ocean-going tankers.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • WFC

    More on Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC): Net interest margin of 3.91% is 2 bps greater than Q4 and 14 bps...

    More on Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC): Net interest margin of 3.91% is 2 bps greater than Q4 and 14 bps worse than 2011 Q1. Net charge-offs were $2.4B, $245M less than Q4, bringing the annualized rate to 1.25%, the lowest level since 2007. Reserve release of $400M accounted for about 10% of total income. The company sees continued but slower improvement in credit this year. Shares -2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • LEN

    Lennar (LEN +1.3%), Toll Brothers (NYSE:TOL), and PulteGroup (PHM +1.9%) are all upgraded to Buy...

    Lennar (LEN +1.3%), Toll Brothers (NYSE:TOL), and PulteGroup (PHM +1.9%) are all upgraded to Buy by KeyBanc, which thinks "sustained local job growth" will give the homebuilders a lift. The firm thinks Toll's high-end focus and land acquisitions should allow it to deliver the best performance of the group, while PulteGroup is declared to be its "most cyclical call."
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) is cut to Equalweight at Barclays and its price target reduced to $4 from $8,...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) is cut to Equalweight at Barclays and its price target reduced to $4 from $8, with the analysts saying the deterioration in its core mobile phone business is significantly worse than anticipated. Shares -1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM | 7 Comments
  • INFY

    Infosys Technologies (NASDAQ:INFY): FQ4 EPS of Rs.40.54 may not be comparable to consensus of...

    Infosys Technologies (NASDAQ:INFY): FQ4 EPS of Rs.40.54 may not be comparable to consensus of Rs.41.26. Revenue of $1.77B (+22.1% Y/Y). Shares -12.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:52 AM | 1 Comment
